titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the United Nations should suspend the membership of any state identified as a sponsor of terrorism by the Department of State.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 12/19/2001--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that the United Nations should suspend the membership of any state identified as a sponsor of terrorism by the Department of State until such time as the state takes concerted and effective action to eliminate terrorist activities within its borders and ceases funding and support for terrorist activities outside its borders.
